fi.tuni.mental_run

Class GameOver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.Game
      • fi.tuni.mental_run.GameProject
        • fi.tuni.mental_run.GameOver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public class GameOver
extends GameProject
    GameOver is for implementing the game over view.

    GameOver draws the view that was seen when the run ended, a turquoise board, a game over announcement with points the player got together, a question about what the player wants to do next and the back and retry buttons or the skip & retry, skip & back and enter buttons depending on the situation. The player is prompted for a name if they want to submit their high score to the high scores list. GameOver also checks for user input for all of these buttons. GameProject host is forwarded to HighScores, Run1, Run2, Run3 and LevelSelectionMenu. Extends GameProject.

    Author:
    Joni MÃ¤kinen

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(float playerPosY,
                 int levelVariable,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont roboto,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont largerRoboto,
                 GameProject host,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch batch,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music menuBackgroundMusic,
                 com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music runBackgroundMusic,
                 boolean musicOn,
                 boolean soundOn,
                 java.lang.String myPoints)
        Draws a turquoise board and on the board a congratulations text and a crown or a text indicating the game is over.

        Points the player got are also drawn and the buttons back and retry or skip & retry, skip & back and enter depending on if the player made it to the high scores list or not.

        Parameters:
        playerPosY - is used in determining the y coordinate for the game over display
        levelVariable - is forwarded further to didIMakeIt and checkInput. is the integer value (1, 2 or 3) that has the information on which level's high scores are about to be inspected.
        roboto - font used in drawing of congratulations text and text indicating the game is over
        largerRoboto - the larger font used in drawing of the points
        host - GameProject host
        batch - batch from Run1, Run2 and Run3. its draw function is called here
        menuBackgroundMusic - the menu background music
        runBackgroundMusic - the run background music
        musicOn - has info if music is toggled
        soundOn - has info if sounds are toggled
        myPoints - is forwarded further to didIMakeIt and checkInput. contains the amount of points the player got. in didIMakeIt, it is compared to the last amount of points on the high scores list. In checkInput it is forwarded further.

      • checkInput

        public void checkInput(int levelVariable,
                       float playerPosY,
                       boolean musicOn,
                       boolean soundOn,
                       com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music menuBackgroundMusic,
                       com.badlogic.gdx.audio.Music runBackgroundMusic,
                       boolean result,
                       java.lang.String myPointsString)
        Checks for user input for buttons back, retry, skip & retry, skip & back and enter.

        Also prompts the player for a name in case they want to submit their high score.

        Parameters:
        levelVariable - is forwarded further to HighScores where it is used to determine which level's high scores to display
        playerPosY - is used when determining the y coordinate for the buttons to be drawn
        musicOn - has info if music is toggled
        soundOn - has info if sounds are toggled
        menuBackgroundMusic - the menu background music
        runBackgroundMusic - the run background music
        result - tells the function which buttons' input to check
        myPointsString - the amount of the player's points

      • didIMakeIt

        public boolean didIMakeIt(int levelVariable,
                          int myPoints)
        Finds out if the player made it to the high scores list or not.
        Parameters:
        levelVariable - tells the function which level's high scores to compare to the player's score
        myPoints - the amount of the player's points
        Returns:
        Returns result which tells draw if the player made it to the high scores list or not
